text: Lewiston is a village in Niagara County, New York, United States. The population was 2,531 at the 2020 census. The village is named after Morgan Lewis, an early 19th-century governor of New York. It is part of the Buffaloâ€“Niagara Falls Metropolitan Statistical Area. The town supervisor is Steve Broderick. The village mayor is Anne Welch. ==References== Category:Villages in New York (state)
title: Lewiston (village), New York
